column4: can anyone suggest a way to make this old box serve files faster?
I might as well just buy a new computer then
will that help serve files faster?
because I'm trying to stream a movie and it's pretty choppy
so no one can think of a way to get better speeds from this box?
kill any unnecessary process (free up CPU cycles), get a 10/100 "switch" (not a "hub"... big difference), try using a different file access method (do you HAVE to use SMB?)
thanks auTONYmous, but how can I not use smb?
and how do I kill/find processes?
all the other boxes Windblows, huh?
you're stuck with it, so look at the server's processes first, then be sure the network is optimized (the "switch" I referred to a minute ago will help GREATLY)
glenc: it's the central network device that ALL your other PC's are plugged into to create the "network"
glenc: if you have a "hub" now, all your pc's are sharing the total network speed...
